name: Aerie, the wingless Avariel - Cleric 19 / Illusionist 19 / Monk 2
author: Kane

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
Hail, ECBers!

I have just finalized what I consider to be a really cool concept build. Aerie is an Avariel Cleric / Mage multiclass from the Baldur's Gate Saga, who lost her wings and wound up in a Circus travelling with an old Illusionist named Quayle. She was really needy (like a real pain in the arse sometimes), easily offended, but also very pure and always eager to help. As Mick Dagger, Valerfor and I discussed back and forth several possible builds for her, I came up with this concept. In 3rd edition rules, I would need a lot of craftiness to translate what she was all about. She was always kind of frail (low CON) and cast a ton of spells when in your party, and she died quite quickly when enemies got in melee range (and I didn't click fast enough to get her out of trouble). Well, Clerics don't have ANY no-save spells, so if I had gone for split stats (half and half between INT and WIS), half of her spells (the Cleric side) would have become useless. Wizards, on the other hand, have many options when it comes to no-save spells. Magic Missile, ILMS, IGMS are my favorite attack ones, but also the Bigby line and Time Stop, Spell Breaches, Mord's, Tenser's Transformation, Improved Invisibility, Damage Shields, Spell Mantle line, etc..

A sacrifice needed to be made in order to make both her sources of spell useful, and there's also Zen Archery, which makes WIS be the attacking stat and Monk AC bonus which also uses WIS. So, it was not as hard. She will use Cleric spells for killing with save spells, snipe with a bow to conserve her spells, scribe scrolls to have many tools and use the no-save wizard spells to be a very versatile caster. BUT, then there was the low CL issue, which was addressed with the taking of all Penetration feats. In combination with Mord's (preferrably from scrolls), is enough to pierce Toolset SR cap of 32. So, she can handle herself pretty well. Some Drow and high-level Monk enemies will be challenging but doable. She can snipe them and hide behind a Summoned Creature, use Invisibility potions or Scrolls or just stop time and either flee or kill.

She is VERY DISPELLABLE, so that is something that you need to know and prepare for in advance. You can deal with dispel-spammers in many different ways: stopping time and attacking, Bigby 6ing them to the ground, or simply blowing out IGMSs at their faces, stopping time so they can't heal. Or buffing from scrolls and conserving her buffs for after she's been dispelled. I think this is a very faithful build to the character and I hope most who have played BG saga will agree. Thanks to Mick and Valerfor for the (slightly heated) discussions that led to the completion of this build.

Aerie, the wingless Avariel:

Cleric(19), Illusionist(19), Monk(2), Elf

Alignment: Any Lawful

Playability: 1-40 PvM (might do well PvP too)

STR: 8
DEX: 16

Valerfor suggested a tweak that is worth mentioning. If you want your Evocation spells DC to be slightly higher and to be able to acommodate Craft Wand in pre-epics, delay GSF: Evocation to epics, drop 2 Great Wisdom and take GSF and ESF in Evocation. The balance is:

- You gain: Craft Wand and +1 DC for Evocation spells
- You lose: 1 AB, 1 AC, 1 DC for all spells from other schools (which there aren't many useful ones, I only ever use Destruction and Storm of Vengeance, but especially SoV I use a lot).

I would rather not mess with the usefulness of SoV for my playing style, but if you think the above trade is worthwhile, it's doable.

There are some builds in the Search Engine that could be compared to this one, except they all have a very different layout. 4 builds have 23 Wiz / 17 Cleric, two have Monk as well (the two that inspired my Magical Master) and there are two other builds here. My Magical Master and my Speedy Sniper, but neither is even close to the same concept. A very well-rounded high-AC, good-AB, Zen-Arching Divine and Arcane dual-caster whose primary focus is SPELLS (not buffs and combat), but who can hold her own if the need arises as long as enemies are far away. I like this build a lot not because it's UBER-powerful, but because it's very well thought out and demanded extreme building finesse on my part. Like a father whose son got an A, I am proud of the way my Aerie turned out.

Take it EZ!

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Clerics don't have any non-save spells?! That's news to me.. What about "Harm and Word Of Faith" then?

I agree on boosting one stat over having an equal split in both of them, this way she is more effective. Is she very dispelllable indeed? I don't know.. Mathematics say, she is 20% dispellable which is somewhat dispellable but a lot more reliable from a 15 CL Cleric that get's dispelled 40% at a time. What i want to say is that it is a decent build, that's all ;-)

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
Valerfor wrote:
Clerics don't have any non-save spells?! That's news to me.. What about "Harm and Word Of Faith" then?

I agree on boosting one stat over having an equal split in both of them, this way she is more effective. Is she very dispelllable indeed? I don't know.. Mathematics say, she is 20% dispellable which is somewhat dispellable but a lot more reliable from a 15 CL Cleric that get's dispelled 40% at a time. What i want to say is that it is a decent build, that's all ;-)
Hey dude!

Word of Faith dispels summons and blinds, but is hardly a spell you can rely on for killing. Harm is a spell that is cast up-close with a melee touch attack, which is ill-advised for her to say the least, since she's supposed to stay away from physical confrontations to shine, but I guess I should've said that Clerics have no reliable no-save spells. I know you get my point, but anyway. Harm is a 6th level spell, WoF is a 7th level spell, what about 8th and 9th level spells? I do use them, especially WoF, but not for killing, more for crowd control and summon dispelling. Since she kills things with spells, I reckon she needs to rely on DCs for Cleric spells.

As for dispellability we are talking exclusively about Greater Dispelling, because Mord's cast by any even mediocre caster will strip you of all your buffs most likely. So yeah, she's very dispellable. But she's also very resourceful, so it's OK.

Thanks :D

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content:
Creeping Doom from Plant domain has a save only for the initial damage and no spell resistance. Ice Storm and Melf's Acid Arrow from Magic domain have spell resistance but no save.
If you take Plant and Water, you would get both Creeping Doom and Ice Storm, and you could turn vermin and elementals. This does not constitute a recommendation that you take those 2 domains.

Not for an artillery toon like this one.  They are sweet!  Especially the Extended CD. For melee, yah... they suck.

Note on build:  -20% XP penalty from level 17 to 40.

posts.author: Maximillian_Kane
posts.content:
Hail, folks!

I have actually found a way to improve this build ever so slightly. Because of feat constraints, I hadn't been able to take ESF: Evocation on the original build. Then, I realized that if I swapped a Cleric level for a Wizard level, I'd get a bonus feat, which I could use to boost my spell DCs by another 2 points. Also, I delayed Epic Spell Penetration a little, just to get my INT up ASAP and get more skill points. Thus, I tweaked her this way:

DEX: 16
CON: 10
WIS: 16 (32)
INT: 16 (19)
CHA: 8

posts.author: kfor85
posts.content:
Hey there, I was thinking of rolling this one up after almost finishing with Magical Master.
Considering my observations with MM and since their shortcomings are similar, I would definitely give this gal craft wand as I found it quite helpful to overcome the dispels/mords flying around everywhere. 
Do you think dropping the focus on evocation feats and going Craft Wand, Called Shot and Epic Prowess instead is viable?

K

posts.author: Maximillian_Kane
posts.content:
kfor85 wrote: ↑
Nov 30, 2020
Hey there, I was thinking of rolling this one up after almost finishing with Magical Master.
Considering my observations with MM and since their shortcomings are similar, I would definitely give this gal craft wand as I found it quite helpful to overcome the dispels/mords flying around everywhere. 
Do you think dropping the focus on evocation feats and going Craft Wand, Called Shot and Epic Prowess instead is viable?

K
Heya!

Well, you know what I'll say. Wands give you comfort, but aren't necessary. If you drop the Evocation focus, what will happen is you'll lose 6 points on your Implosion DC to do something that you have other ways of doing already (scrolls). The thing about her is that, despite being the same 3 classes as the MM, she's actually VERY different to play. For starters, she's an archer, which makes her easier to play early on, and harder to play in high epics. Secondly, I made her worship Ehlonna, which means she has improved Summons. And finally, she has access to tools that the MM doesn't have, like high-DC 9th level spells on the Cleric side, which would be a shame to lose, and IMO would limit her effectiveness. Why don't you have the MM craft her the wands you want, but them from him, and keep her as is? I'll PM you about something.

Cheers!
